DIV1.P: By the AUTHOR of the ESSAY on MAN.
LONDON: Printed for R. DODSLEY, at Tully's-Head, in Pall-mall. MDCCXXXVIII. (Price Six-Pence.)

LG.HEAD: I.
LG.L: FATHER of All! in every Age,
In every Clime ador'd,
By Saint, by Savage, and by Sage,
Jehovah, Jove, or Lord!

LG.HEAD: II.
LG.L: Thou Great First Cause, least understood!
Who all my Sense confin'd
To know but this,â€”that Thou art Good,
And I my self am blind:

LG.HEAD: III.
LG.L: Yet gave me, in this dark Estate,
To see the Good from Ill;
And binding Nature fast in Fate,
Left Conscience free, and Will.

LG.HEAD: IV.
LG.L: What Conscience dictates to be done,
Or warns me not to doe,
This, teach me more than Hell to shun,
That, more than Heav'n pursue.

LG.HEAD: V.
LG.L: What Blessings thy free Bounty gives,
Let me not cast away;
For God is pay'd when Man receives,
T'enjoy, is to obey.

LG.HEAD: VI.
LG.L: Yet not to Earth's contracted Span,
Thy Goodness let me bound;
Or think thee Lord alone of Man,
When thousand Worlds are round.

LG.HEAD: VII.
LG.L: Let not this weak, unknowing hand
Presume Thy Bolts to throw,
And deal Damnation round the land,
On each I judge thy Foe.

LG.HEAD: VIII.
LG.L: If I am right, thy Grace impart
Still in the right to stay;
If I am wrong, oh teach my heart
To find that better Way.

LG.HEAD: IX.
LG.L: Save me alike from foolish Pride,
Or impious Discontent,
At ought thy Wisdom has deny'd,
Or ought thy Goodness lent.

LG.HEAD: X.
LG.L: Teach me to feel another's Woe;
To hide the Fault I see;
That Mercy I to others show,
That Mercy show to me.

LG.HEAD: XI.
LG.L: Mean tho' I am, not wholly so
Since quicken'd by thy Breath,
Oh lead me wheresoe'er I go,
Thro' this day's Life, or Death:

LG.HEAD: XII.
LG.L: This day, be Bread and Peace my Lot;
All else beneath the Sun,
Thou know'st if best bestow'd, or not;
And let Thy Will be done.

LG.HEAD: XIII.
LG.L: To Thee, whose Temple is all Space,
Whose Altar, Earth, Sea, Skies;
One Chorus let all Being raise!
All Nature's Incence rise!
